root.message: The RATIONALE field for indicator 5-1-1, translated into en
root.data: The sex ratio at birth (also known as the sex ratio at birth) reflects the sex balance of the number of new born children in a period (usually a calendar year). Normally, this ratio ranges from 103 to 107 and is stable over time and space. Any change in this ratio that deviates from the normal range reflects an intentional intervention to some extent and affects the natural sex imbalance, threatening population instability. number.
